creator: shashi.kumar280@gmail.com
text:
Hi,

I have recently installed Apache 2.2.23 on a REHL 64 bit. I have 3 tomcat instances 5.5.26 running on the same server. I wanted to connect Apache with Tomcat, So i downloaded mod_jk version 1.2.37 did a build from source on the server, this gave me mod_jk.so. After that i configured the hhtpd.conf and worker.properties file for mod_jk. But after that when i tried starting the Apache server, it failed to start giving the following error:

“httpd: Syntax error on line 148 of /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf: Cannot load /etc/httpd/modules/mod_jk.so into server: /etc/httpd/modules/mod_jk.so: undefined symbol: ap_get_server_description”

I am not able to figure out the reason. Please help me on this.

Thanks,
Shashi

creator: christophe.jaillet@wanadoo.fr
text: *** Bug 54432 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: covener@gmail.com
text:
ap_get_server_description was added in 2.2.4. Looks like you may have compiled against a different server than you loaded it into.

You might also search the web for "mod_jk.so: undefined symbol: ap_get_server_description”"

creator: shashi.kumar280@gmail.com
text:
Hi Eric,

I had compiled it on the server saying usr/local/apache2/bin/apxs which is for server Apache 2.2.23. I m not sure if that can be the problem. I did looked in google and saw that this was a bug in apache 2.2.4 version and was fixed.

If possible can you please help me on following:

1) Please tell some place where i can get mod_jk.so built for Apache 2.2.23. Is this possible?

2)if not can you please tell if httpd-2.2.3-65.el5_8 is a different version to Apache 2.2.23. Actually i installed Apache from source but i still see a RPM httpd running on the server. I am confused if source installation adds the httpd to RPM database in the server? if that is the case then no problem but if not then you are right that the mod_jk.so got complied on a different version of apache.

Thanks a lot Eric for showing me the way.

Please do help me on the above two questions.

Thanks,
Shashi

creator: covener@gmail.com
text: You might want to try for help on the users discussion lists.

creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text: Or add the flag "--enable-api-compatibility" to configure when compiling mod_jk.

creator: shashi.kumar280@gmail.com
text:
(In reply to comment #5)
> Or add the flag "--enable-api-compatibility" to configure when compiling
> mod_jk.

Thanks Everyone,

I have fixed that issue. Issue was with mod_jk connector.

Thanks,
Shashi.
